result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott L Peebles

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
ADA Colleen Lennon appeared for the State. Attorney Mark A. Leonard appeared in person on behalf of Defn. Defn appearance waived. STC scheduled.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Barry P or Lois P.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

1:32 PM Defendant Scott L Peebles in court, in custody via Zoom.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Scott L Peebles.  Prosecuting attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Appearances by victims. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant waived receipt a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Defendant will receive a copy of the Complaint with the bond forms. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statements by victims.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
